title: Definition and Scope of Communication
introduction: Communication is the process of sharing information and ideas between people or groups. It's very important in both business world and private life.

content.value: Communication is the process of sharing information and ideas between people or groups.
Developing strong communication skill becomes one of the top priorities for a leader.
Express your thoughts in simple way such that your friends or colleagues or anyone can understand easily.
Effective communication offers many benefits:
Listening
It uses understanding of spoken or written information, it also builds how need to speak. It creates everyone to express ideas, opinions, your feeling, plan, solving problem.
Straight Talking

Discuss with friends or colleagues on the topic given, build some mutual trust and solve the problem before the issue is serious. Talk about the topic to most of the people who you trusted makes clear ideas on solving the issue.
Non Verbal

When we talk we will have more non verbal. But keep much focus on break less communication, body position/seating, facial expression, your posture, eye contact, voice tone, Whatever you speak be confident even it is non verbal.
Make sure that your thought has reached to the other person properly.
There is research in 2014 â€“ Marketing people will speak more than 90% of Non verbal, while selling the brand/product.
Clear
While writing or speaking be clear on the message.
Concise
Stick to the point and keep it brief about the topic (don't deviate from topic).
Concrete
If the message is concrete from your side, the audience will have clear picture what you are telling.
Coherent (Logical)
If the communication is logical, all points will connect to the relevant topic.
Complete
Make sure the audience has everything they need about the topic given to you.
Courteous
Communication should always be friendly, open and honest.

items: Ask any of your friends to give honest feedback to understand your area of improvement of communication. It can help you identify what to focus on (If the criticism your friends you don't feel bad).
Many skills are habits you developed over time. On regular practice you can become a good communicator.
Attend more communication workshops like online or offline seminars. Attend more number of classes to practice which includes instruction, role-play, written assignment and open discussion.
Always try to grab the opportunity to develop your skills.
Listening only doesn't help you, need to practice and participate.

content.value: Listen
Most of us do more talking than listening. Make sure take the time to really listen to what people are saying by their words, tone and body language.
Come alongside the other person
Please agree with your friend on the discussion and create a trust in you. Don't judge or try to correct. Try to support and let them know you care.
Check your tone and body language
Please check your tone and body language always during the conversation.
Be real
Be real to the communicator. Don't be frustrated, be real and honest.

exercises.title: Effective Communication Analysis
exercises.instructions: Read each scenario and identify which of the Six Cs of communication is being violated.

questions.question: A manager sends an email with vague instructions for a project without specifying deadlines or expected outcomes.
questions.answer: Clear - The communication lacks clarity about expectations and timelines.

questions.question: A presenter spends 10 minutes giving background information unrelated to the topic before getting to the main point.
questions.answer: Concise - The communication contains unnecessary information that distracts from the main message.

questions.question: A team leader sends an update that contains several contradictory statements about project priorities.
questions.answer: Coherent - The communication lacks logical flow and contains contradictory information.

exercises.title: Communication Improvement Plan
exercises.instructions: Create a personal communication improvement plan by identifying one weakness in your communication style and three specific actions you can take to improve it.

questions.question: Sample response: Weakness - I tend to interrupt others when they're speaking. Improvement actions: 1) Wait three seconds after someone finishes speaking before responding, 2) Take notes while others are speaking instead of planning my response, 3) Ask follow-up questions to show I'm engaged rather than trying to contribute my own ideas too quickly.
questions.answer: This is a reflection exercise. Answers will vary, but should include a specific weakness and concrete improvement actions.
